headline.main: NAZIS FAIL TO GET ANY OIL AT MAIKOP; Russians Return to the Area Before Enemy Is Able to Repair Plugged Drillings CAMPAIGN WAS DIFFICULT Two Soviet Forces Attacked After March Over Mountains From the Black Sea

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Jan. 31 -- A thirty-five-mile advance toward Krasnodar from Kropotkin, indicated by last night's announcement of the capture of Ladojskaya on the Kuban River, the complete clearing of the Maikop oil fields by a two-pronged advance from the Black Sea and the fall of Tikhoretsk have reduced the German hold on Russia south of the Don River to a dangerous narrow salient with one flank uncomfortably against the Black and Azov Seas.
abstract: USSR repts Ger hold south of Don River cut by USSR capture of Ladojskaya

byline.original: By RALPH PARKERWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
